title: Unstable features for `libcore` 1.49

milestone.title: HIR Pipeline for libcore 1.49 Complete
milestone.description: Support all of the patterns and features used in libcore 1.49 at the HIR level: this includes, and isn't limited to, complex match patterns, inline assembly, some of the more complex type system features such as specialization, etc.

This is an approximate list of all the unstable features used in `libcore` 1.49 that we will need to handle in one way or another in order to compile it properly. Some of them should be relatively easy, like the `const_*` ones or `nll` which we can simply ignore for now (but not forever of course) but the ones related to the type system (`never_type`, `negative_impl`...) sound like a bit more work.

@flip1995 @bjorn3 if you have any thoughts on the list, their importance or their difficulty, please share :) you're the ones with the most intimate knowledge of them
